author: yobozorle
title: LOOZR
description: Loozr is a cryptocurrency-powered music streaming platform that allows everyone to invest in and profit from the success of artists.

f6_assessments.q0: In order to facilitate the profitability of artists, the project tries to create a platform that brings more democratic monetization to musicians, creating an environment where there are several ways of financial return for them, and also for users or other stakeholders. We can thus see that the central idea of the project is to use Cardano technologies to reduce bureaucracy in a segment that is highly populated by intermediary agents that mitigate a good part of the gains. With this, the proposal fits the metrics of the challenge in question. And as music is an unrestricted industry, the success of this project could bring great visibility to Cardano's ecosystem, as the idea is highly scalable. However, we found a considerable problem in relation to the budget being requested of $350,000, as it is a very high value given the current characteristics of the project, as we will see below.
f6_assessments.q1:
As mentioned before, we have a problem regarding the amount being asked, and in fact yet another contradiction arises. When looking at the budget detail, the total capital required is $80,000, which is contradictory information to what was initially exposed. Considering this last mentioned value, we realize that by the current organization, we have that approximately 62% of the budget would be destined to marketing. It makes sense that special attention should be given to this point, as it is a new concept and should be introduced to the public. But perhaps this budget division jeopardizes the production of other steps that were described in the plan.

In fact, it is worth mentioning that one of the factors that seems to harm the viability of the project would be the amount of possibilities that the platform intends to deliver. We see the possibility of marketing different types of tokens, multiple forms of profitability, development of regional resources and even plans to launch versions 2.0 and 3.0. Bearing in mind that a beta version of this Dapp is yet to be released, it seems interesting that the number of features were a little smaller, so that there is a beta version that is less comprehensive and more focused on testing public receptivity. Additionally, considering the size of the project, it would be nice if we had the CVs of more professionals involved. Both in the proposal and on the project's website, we find only the curriculum of the founder of the idea. However, it is worth mentioning that the project presents some innovative concepts, such as the tokenization of moments ($MOMENT), as we know the popularity and reach of short videos on current social media. With that, it seems that with the adjustments of some points, this project that has good potential would become more viable.
f6_assessments.q2:
Given the entire audience that the project aims to reach, it seems interesting that there were more ways to monitor the proposal, which would work concurrently with the commits made on Github. For example, the Miro tool could be used to carry out periodic, perhaps even weekly, updates on the completion of steps. Another idea would be to create a group on Telegram with the participation of developers and the public, so that instant feedback could be collected.

Regarding the team's perception of success, it is positive to see that a desired amount of artists and creators has been established that must be present on the platform in a given period. But in addition, it seems nice to stipulate other quantitative parameters that help in this measurement of success, such as:

Expected engagement goal of the project on social media

Monthly average growth in relation to listeners to be achieved

Expected revenue in the beta version of the app

f6_assessments.q0: If succeeded it could bring millions of people to the Cardano blockchain from all demographics. Cardano could make the gap smaller between artist and listener/fan and could provide upcoming artists with a chance beyond the music producers.
f6_assessments.q1:
The idea is not completely new. If you do a quick google search for "blockchain music streaming platform" you notice a lot of teams working on a similar idea. If the execution and product give the users a better experience it could be possible to penetrate this market.

My concern is the lack of diverse team members (only one team member listed). To make a project like this work you need people familiar with developing apps but also with the music industry, lawyers, advertisers,... If there were no competing projects I think these challenges could be overcome but at this time I believe there should be extra team members.
f6_assessments.q2: There is a long time structured plan to tackle the project. There is also a clear end goal: "Onboarding 5,000 artists and creators for our Q4 2022".

f6_assessments.q0: The proposed solution implementation is quite clear and well described. The team did an in-depth study and analysis of the music streaming field. The proposal touches the core because the proposed measure has an impact on the challenge posed. The team has detailed and logical solutions to develop for the arts and the ecosystem. And also considered a number of risks and disarmament to minimize the risks they will face when implementing the project.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposal's plan is laid out with a clear roadmap divided into four quarters and organized by milestones. However, the budget table does not seem reasonable for what is allocated. Teams are people with full experience and necessary skills to carry out the project. Proposal will be strong and transparent if there is a detailed timetable and budget. For example: Budget for each quarter, for each period, salary of each member, their job and working time...
f6_assessments.q2: It will be easier to audit and measure the successful progress of the project if there are a few more KPI metrics in the milestones. How many artists, creators, user communities will be enhanced and promoted each quarter. A proposal will be more successful and transparent if it has a more in-depth, detailed plan.

f6_assessments.q0:
The project presents a novel way musicians could interact with fans and supporters and possibly even potential investors. This in theory could have an impact on the adoption and usage of the Cardano blockchain.
But judging from the proposal I’m left unconvinced that the proposed solution would actually work in practice, thus substantially reducing the potential impact of the proposal.

The answer given to the “describe how your proposed solution will address the challenge?” is not adequate as it refers to the way the project will be tracked, not the way it addresses the challenge. Having said that the answer to that question and to the general impact question can be deduced from the first part of the proposal.
f6_assessments.q1:
“Roadmap Creation” is listed as a step on the roadmap presented, however, that would have been a necessary step to be included in the proposal itself.
The dates presented on the roadmap are not in sync with the Catalyst schedule and the team doesn’t make it clear if they intend to start working on the project regardless of the project being funded or not, or if they already started work.

Without knowing the exact roadmap how is the Catalyst community to know what exactly we are funding? The general vision for the project is presented in the first part of the proposal, but it’s not mentioned if the requested amount covers all the stages of development.

The budget breakdown is overly general and covers only a fraction of the total requested budget of 350000.
f6_assessments.q2:
Github commits are mentioned in the auditability section of the proposal, but apart from that this section is very sparse, almost none existent. No KPIs are present, no clear metrics to be tracked and verified by the community, no other efforts of self-tracking or reporting are mentioned apart from the Github commits.
I would definitely recommend including all these elements if a future iteration is ever submitted, as they would be necessary parts of a successful proposal.
The very brief definition of success that is given seems unrealistic, especially for Q4, 2022.
